availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Schake (Boonville, Indiana, major (U.S.A.) and laborer)

body.p: Boonville, Warwick County, Indiana, day laborer and soldier. Native of Germany. Married to Sophiah Schake. Father of John Schake. Day laborer in Boonville, Indiana, in 1860. Served in the North Cumberland Battalion of the Kentucky State Militia (U.S.A.) as major from December 1, 1864, to August 28, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Warrick County, Boonville, p. 870.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), pp. 776, 958.
KYR-0002-060-0022.
